text.p: Eurotunnel resumed full freight services through the Channel Tunnel Sunday for the first time since the fire that injured several people and caused 200 million pounds ($325 million) of damage last November.
"Commercial service started at the beginning of this afternoon," said Michelle Fox, community affairs manager for Eurotunnel.
She said the first service left Folkestone, England, shortly after noon, carrying 23 trucks after three weeks of trials.
Eurotunnel was planning a full service of up to three departures an hour in each direction between Folkestone and Calais, France, she said.
"We were very satisfied with the results of the trials," she said.
